intro: Trema orientale var. bicornis, commonly known as the two-horned trema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
